title: Build An AI-Video Generation App With Veo 3 + Next.js (Cursor, fal.ai)

Hey everyone, in this video, we're going to build a web application that can generate videos. I'm using Next.js here, and I'm using the Veo 3 model by Google to actually generate the videos. So let me actually just show you how it works. So the user can write a prompt, click on generate video, and then in about 1 and 1/2 minutes, return a video here. But let's actually try it out. So let's say dog and cat racing on the street, and let's just see what it can do with that. Uh, I'll click on generate video. So, now we just have to wait a little bit, and I'll get back to you when it's finished. And there we go. In about 1 and 1/2, 2 minutes, I have a video here. Let's actually check it out. And of course, you've probably seen these videos. They're really good. Uh, there is some audio. So, hopefully, you can hear that a little bit as well. Uh, but the results are really good. And yeah, you've seen them on social media probably. They're blowing up or going viral actually. So, let's actually try to build a web app that allows users to generate videos like this. So I'm using the Veo 3 model, and I'm using it through a service called fal. So fal offers a bunch of models and actually makes it really easy for us to uh use these models. I'm not affiliated with them, but that is what I'm using here. So these videos tend to be 8 seconds long, and you can generate them with audio. The only downside is that as of recording, it is still quite expensive. So I think it's about, well, let's actually take a look. Yeah. So here on fal, for every second of video you generated, you will be charged 50 cents with audio off or 75 cents with audio on. So a 5-second video may already cost $3.75.
